title.narrative: Guardian Foundation, incubator for independent media
Guardian Foundation, inkubator för oberoende media

description.narrative:
The Guardian Foundation har ansökt till Sida om finansiering på 9 781 200 SEK för att genomföra insatsen "Incubator for Independent Turkish Media" under åren 2020-2023.
Insatsen syftar till att bygga kapacitet och stödja högkvalitativa oberoende turkiska medier för att bidra till en stark och rättvis demokrati där medierna har kraft att påverka och agera och det civila samhället har kunskap och känner sig bemyndigad att agera.
Insatsens totala finansiering är 9 781 200 SEK och Sida är ensam finansiär. Runt 6,46 miljoner SEK av insatsens budget kommer att vidareförmedlas från Guardian Foundation till organisationen Dijital Medya Arastirmalari Dernegi (DMRA) i Turkiet.

The Guardian Foundation has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 9 781 200 to implement the initiative "Incubator for Independent Turkish Media" during the years 2020-2023.
The effort aims to build capacity and support high-quality independent Turkish media to contribute to a strong and fair democracy where the media have the power to influence and act and civil society has the knowledge and authority to act.
The total financing of the initiative is SEK 9 781 200 and Sida is the sole financier. Around SEK 6.46 million of the initiative's budget will be passed on from the Guardian Foundation to the organization Dijital Medya Arastirmalari Dernegi(DMRA) based in Turkey

The intervention is based on the premise that a functioning independent media landscape contributes to better informed citizens who are able to participate meaningfully in democratic processs. The objective of the intervention is to build capacity of and support high quality independent Turkish journalism so that it contributes to a strong and just democracy where civil society are informed and empowered to participate, influence and act. It also aims to support the development of a range of new media concepts such as podcasts, online magazines and YouTube channels.

description.narrative:
From the first year of implementation (November 2020- December 2021) the below results can be noted.
-Original pieces of publicly available research on the media and information landscape in Turkey published including themes such as journalists' employment; fact-checking; layouts of news media websites; main revenue models for digital news platforms; news coverage of ordinary citizens; news coverage on refugees; social media usage practice of journalists; polarization in the news reporting; news media and the climate crisis. The report concludes that, thanks to the relatively high readership of the research as well as to that the research has been picked up by media outlets it has been successful in prompting debate among the media in Turkey.
-Strengthened capacities of Turkish journalists and media professionals a) Training of experienced journalists and media professionals within cutting edge journalistic practices (delivered by Guardian staff) b) Training of Trainers to experienced journalists and media professionals to become trainers in the incubator programme c) Training and mentoring of freelancers and early-career journalists in sustainable, ethical, professional and public interest reporting d) Regional academies delivered for journalists based in Eastern region and the Mediterranean region of Turkey, to address the gap in provision of journalism training in non-urban areas
-Development of a Master trainer curriculum and resources and training plan for ToT delivery
-Innovative journalism products delivered with the support of mini-grants and mentoring within the incubator programme
-Digital content published on the latest journalism practices and debates, including through articles, podcasts, videos and a weekly newsletter
